STIMER Example
Peripheral Examples

Detailed Description

Purpose: This example demonstrates STIMER (Secure Timer) functionality for precise timing and interrupt-driven operations. The application showcases STIMER configuration, interrupt handling, and periodic task execution with LED control for visual feedback. The example implements timing control using 32kHz crystal oscillator for accurate timekeeping and demonstrates proper interrupt service routine management for reliable system timing.

Key Features

  1. STIMER Configuration: Demonstrates STIMER setup and interrupt configuration for precise timing operations
  2. Interrupt Driven Control: Implements STIMER interrupt service routine for periodic task execution and timing control
  3. LED Visual Feedback: Provides LED control for visual feedback of timer operation and system status
  4. Crystal Oscillator Timing: Uses 32kHz crystal oscillator for accurate and stable timing operations
  5. Periodic Task Execution: Implements periodic task execution with configurable timing intervals for system operations

Functionality

The application performs the following operations:

  • Initializes STIMER with 32kHz crystal oscillator configuration
  • Implements STIMER interrupt service routine for periodic tasks
  • Provides LED visual feedback for timer operation status
  • Implements precise timing control with configurable intervals
  • Demonstrates proper interrupt handling and task scheduling
  • Monitors system timing and provides visual status updates

Usage

  1. Compile and download the application to target device
  2. Observe LED behavior for timer operation feedback
  3. Monitor ITM output for timing status and configuration
  4. Verify STIMER interrupt operation and timing accuracy

Configuration

  • WAKE_INTERVAL_IN_MS: Configurable wake interval (default: 1000ms)
  • XT_PERIOD: Crystal oscillator period (32kHz)
  • WAKE_INTERVAL: Calculated timer interval value
  • AM_IRQ_PRIORITY_DEFAULT: Configurable interrupt priority

Printing takes place over the ITM at 1MHz.

Macros

#define WAKE_INTERVAL_IN_MS   1000
 
#define XT_PERIOD   32768
 
#define WAKE_INTERVAL   (XT_PERIOD * WAKE_INTERVAL_IN_MS / 1000)
